Entities.Name: Risk Factor
Entities.Definition: Clinical determinants identified as contributing to heart disease, which include demographic factors, clinical diagnoses, and treatment history.

Sample Data.Sentence: Patient has a history of smoking and high cholesterol, both known risk factors for heart disease.

Entities.Name: Demographic Factor
Entities.Definition: Patient characteristics such as age, sex, and race, which are used to determine risk profiling for heart diseases.

Entities.Name: Clinical Diagnosis
Entities.Definition: Medical conditions diagnosed in patients, which are relevant to the assessment of heart disease risk.

Entities.Name: Treatment History
Entities.Definition: Records of medical treatments that have been administered to the patient, relevant to heart health.

Dataset.Name: Clinical Texts for Heart Disease Study
Dataset.Details: A collection of clinical texts from electronic health records, annotated for risk factors related to heart disease.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: The annotation process was guided by clinical experts to ensure accurate representation of heart disease risk factors from clinical texts. The annotation followed a structured protocol developed specifically for this task.
Annotation Guidelines.Link: No specific link provided in the document for further guidelines.
